page.title: 01Flooding On Shoreham Beach
page.content: In late November, 1984 torrential rain, storm force winds and high tides combined to produce the worst flooding in living memory on Shoreham Beach. Over one weekend 34 homes and an entire factory were flooded and beach huts were torn apart as the storm carried on and off for 24 hours.The road was completely swamped near the church of the Good Shepherd which was well sand bagged.The Saltings were so badly flooded that it had to be closed to the public.Gardens were turned into lakes. Maybe in the future there will be a real danger to housing on Shoreham Beach and lives may be lost. Between 1980 and 1985 floods became more regular and the sea has come across the sea defences.Nothing much has been done as yet and the situation seems to get worse each year.
